transcript.title: National Cable and Telecommunications Association v. Gulf Power Company

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: submitted We'll hear argument next in number oh oh eight thirty-two, National Cable and Telecommunications Association versus Gulf Power Company.
Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.
Under the Pole Attachments Act, the FCC is required to regulate pole attachments to ensure the the rates, terms, and conditions for those attachments be just and reasonable.
The question presented in this case is whether two particular types of c- attachments are covered by the act.
The first is an attachment to provide cable television service and commingled Internet access.
That means that on, over that particular wire at the particular time is traveling both cable television service and Internet access at different frequencies.
The second type of attachment at issue is an attachment used to provide wireless telecommunications services.
The FCC determined that, and the most natural reading of the act requires that both types of attachments are covered.
The operative provision, the basic coverage provision, defines a pole attachment as any attachment by a cable television system or provider of telecommunications service.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Where do we find the text of the act?
In the appendix to the, our petition for certiorari right at the end.
The language that I'm talking about now is on page two hundred and five A.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: it's, I'm sure it's in our brief also, but it's not in app- it's not separately set forth in an appendix there.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But the, in , sect- the section I'm referring to now is section two twenty-four A four.

It says, the term pole attachment means, any attachment by a cable television system or provider of telecommunications service to a pole, duct, conduit, or right-of-way owned or controlled by a utility.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And don't you think it's implicit in that definition that it mean, in , not just an attachment by, but also an attachment for the purpose of the business of?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: They couldn't put up a billboard, you know yo- you know, i-

I think that the use of the term, in particular, cable television system, it has to be part of the cable television system, which could be reasonably construed to mean the the network of of of devices that are used to provide cable television system service to people.
I think that's correct, and I think probably the same thing is true with the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: is Inter- Internet access part of a cable television system?

The FCC hasn't reached a conclusion on that yet because what the FCC concluded, and I think what the la- most natural reading of the statute leads to the conclusion as well that if an attachment is an attachment that's used to provide cable television system service, the fact, or it's used by a cable television system, the fact that it's also used for something else doesn't exclude...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: If it still is well, it would still be.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: cover- covered under E, under under the telecommunications rate.
I I wouldn't quite say that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: it has purported to reserve that question, hasn't it?
I I wouldn't quite put it that way.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Where where do we find that?
That is on page eighty, the best place to start with is eighty-seven A at paragraph thirty-three.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you think that that issue is up in this case, then, whether...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: saying that the that the that the decision here rests upon that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: here is not whether the court of appeals was right, it's whether the commission was wrong.
rate issue was the the the the court of appeals did not d- did not address, and I don't even think was presented to the court of appeals, what the proper rate is to apply.
Yes, but theoretically it could be...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: as a result of that, we don't know? We cannot tell.
I I don't think that that's correct, what...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: for us to say to the agency, you've got to explain to us what you at least believe your jurisdictional basis is for this because, depending on whether your jurisdictional basis is the general provision or D or E may affect that that that may, the the result in in this case could be dependent on that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I think the agency was very clear that it jurisdi-, its basis for jurisdiction is A four, which is the basic coverage provision of the act, it could, it, and it said...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: then that forces u-, in other words, you're saying the agency made it clear that it was neither D nor E.
All right, and I agree. The it, You can infer, you're right. You can infer that...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: and they said it could be D because it c-, we're not, we don't have to decide whether it is a t- a-, whether the Internet access part of it is a a provision of, is a a cable service because if it's a cable service, it's covered under the terms of D.
Okay, but if i- if it's...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: if it's under D, we we review it strictly within D terms.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: then we've got to decide another issue.
But I I think the agency was quite clear, and they pinned their...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: question of then whether it's D or not is, just has to do with the question of what the right rate is.
Mr. Feldman, are you saying that it's an...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: academic question what the precise rate is when we're dealing with a court of appeals decision that says that's irrelevant because there is no authority at all...
think th- that the point is that is not a a, even almost not a, probably not a possible reading of the statute, and certainly not the one that the FCC, once the FCC adopted a...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you're asking us to say that F, the FCC does have authority.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: basic question is does it have any authority to come up with a just and reasonable rate at all.
And I I would I would a-

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: also the case that we are being forced to decide an issue which, if the agency were clear and came out and said it's D, we wouldn't have to decide.
I I don't think that that's right because whet- whether the agency says it's D or not, the fact is that A four covers this.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, yeah, but that's the, that's one of the...
realize that, but that iss- that issue, it seems to me, is not a difficult one.
doing that, which I can go into.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: anything else that cable does will be telecommunications.
Well, if Congress thought that again, the the result of of if that were true could be that the E rate might apply to this thing, but it would still be that the E rate applied.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But let's assume that FCC determines that this is not telecommunications.
And I think they have determined for the time being...

text_blocks.text: and you have a a hybrid cable.
If it turned out that this additional the addition of Internet access meant that it was neither cable nor telecommunications ser- service, that that that additional service was neither...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: neither of those, then the FCC would have to figure out what the just and reasonable rate would be for that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: more for a hybrid than for a pure cable.
possible the FCC could do that.
the FCC didn't and why the statute...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I'm wondering why that can be because it has no jurisdiction over pure Internet.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: but then I, but my question is why can it possibly charge more for the hybrid...
I don't want to justify that decision because what the FCC decided is that that wouldn't be what it would want to do, and it, if it it decided that if it's a hybrid like...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: They're they're they're they're saying even though the section says you charge this rate when it's cable only, we're going to say you can charge this rate when it's cable plus Internet.

Yes, yes because I think that what Congress wanted to specify when it said when it's cable only is it wanted to ensure that, and and this is actually fairly clear, is when the cable companies went into the into the business of providing telephone service to people, that they would ha- be charged the same rate as the telecommunications providers who were newly added to the act.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: If you ignore the the doctrine inclusio unius, exclusio alterius, and you say these are the rates when it's cable...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And the FCC has come and said, these are also the rates when it's cable...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: If that were true, that could lead to the conclusion that the FCC's choice of rate here was wrong and maybe it should have chosen the E rate or some other rate.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mr. Feldman, do I understand your argument that if we should reverse the Eleventh Circuit and say there is FCC jurisdiction, then it would go then it would have to await your ongoing rulemaking to determine which category this is, or would there be something for the Eleventh Amendment to do on remand once we say you have jurisdiction to do something?

I think that that if the issue was preserved before the Eleventh Circuit, they would have jurisdiction to determine what the right rate is, and they d-, look at what what the FCC's reasoning was and whether, you know, the the various conclusions the FCC reached in coming to the D rate.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the attachment of a cable system.

Well, it's an attachment by a cable television system to the pole, and the system itself is defined as a set of closed transmission paths and associated signal and generation reception control equipment that is designed to provide cable services which include video programming.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But but but but but but that means that they can get away with it only if they are correct that in in choosing to apply the D rate.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: selection of the D rate is wrong, then their assumption that they don't have to get into that question is also wrong.
It could only be wrong in two circumstances.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: You you say they haven't sought cert on it, but but they're they're the respondents here.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, but it seems to me they're they're entitled to defend the the the outcome below on any reaso- on any ground.
But they haven't defended on that ground, Justice Scalia.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: talk for a minute about the attachment of wireless...
Telecommunications, we we don't have a position.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But but the packing of multiple services into this wire, that was considered a good thing.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Internet is concerned, you wouldn't be kicked off.

It's fourty-seven USC, section two two four B one.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: And the page reference again? Excuse me.
It's two oh six A of the appendix to the petition.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: B one says, in pertinent part, that the commission shall regulate the rates, terms, and conditions for pole attachments.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: No, i- it's it's even funnier than that.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But it includes nailing up a wireless thing.

Well, the government's, on this issue and also on the inter issue, Internet issue, they've they've ignored some of the basic rules of reading a statute, and what they've ignored here is the basic rule that you have to read the whole statute and the meaning that any of the phrases, like any attachment here, is informed by context.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: But before you turn to the next section, staying with A four for a minute...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: any attachment to a pole, duct, conduit, or right-of-way owned or controlled by a utility.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Does that language apply to what we're talking about?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: literally the definition does apply regardless of the purpose of the attachment.

If that's if you stop reading if you stop reading the statute there, you could come to that conclusion, but you need to read the whole statute, and if you do, sir, with respect, in D and E there are the two rate formulas.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: may I just cut you short because I want to get m- th- one thought out of my mind.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Do you r- read it as saying provided that the attachment is used either for a D or an E purpose?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: That's So, those are exclusive uses.
under the explu-, w- we'll get to there in a second, but there, it's under the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Under the exclusio unius principle, D and E are the only purposes that are authorized here, and others are intended to be excluded.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I mean, as far as I read D and E, they address a a typical, but not most important, regulatory problem.
I think there's several answers to that question.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: We're We're off on the on the other...
to the other issue, but let me just answer the question quickly, if I could.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: you don't if if if you characterize B the right way.
You'd have to, in order to come to that reading, you'd have to separate this this very detailed set of rate formulas from their general jurisdiction to regulate.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: for anything other than cable and wire service.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: whereas for those areas that are within its special expertise, cable and...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I'm glad you agree with that. I just wonder what's...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: so odd about Congress giving regulatory authority...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: regulatory agency and then taking out two areas, that it happens to be, that the industry is particularly interested in and negotiating a specific formula, while leaving others, times I've seen it a thousand times in regulatory statutes, leaving others for the agency to proceed under normal, ordinary, just, and reasonable rate setting authority.
I I think another answer, and again, I do want to return to the wireless issue because it does tend to get lost in the shuffle here.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: The Off- White House's Office of Telecommunications Policy wrote two letters to Congress expressing that concern when the act was con- being considered, and Congress said, in the legislative history, quite clearly, we're giving the FCC a very narrow grant of jurisdiction.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: very narrow because they're only talking about attachments to utility poles.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: It's a very narrow aspect of the utilities' overall operations.
Not only are they talking about attachments to utility poles, but they're only talking about attachments to utility poles for two kinds of services.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: two kinds of rates, these are the formulas for those two.
If you, well, certainly if you read this canon, if you read the statute with the canon of exp- of expressio unius, you there needs to...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, a- again, i- th- you would...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: not only fixes rates, it requires access.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: w- what you mean by associated equipment, I suppose, is I don't know, joint boxes, lightening arresters, things of that sort.
Associated equipment is equipment that is used to make the wires and the cables work.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Why couldn't associated equipment mean for the for a wireless company, I guess very few of these wireless companies are entirely wireless.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: So, why couldn't the wireless boxes that they nail on these on these poles as pole attachment be deemed associated equipment of these wires that they use elsewhere?
Well, again, it's wires, cables, and associated equipment, and not...
and asso- and associated wires and cables.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to be associated with the very wires and cables that...
ejusdem generis principles, in that phrase, wires, cables, and associated equipment, the associated equipment is subordinate to the words that precede it and is delimited by those two words.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Can you just tell me, where does the term, associated equipment, what section was that in?
It's in section two two four D two on page two oh eight A of the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: when given given the fact, that as somebody pointed out, I guess Justice Scalia pointed out earlier, the wireless companies always have some wires.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Right. It's got to be a...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I I And I think also one last quick point on on wireless.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: sites that are used by a utility.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: sites that are owned by utility companies.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: to mandatory carriage of wire- of of of of wireless?
the ar- that's the government's argument.

This, under this FCC's und- under the FCC's reading of this statute, which is i- impermissible u- if you read the whole statute, they have they have decided to take this revolutionary expansion of their jurisdiction to regulate this tiny piece of the wireless siting market.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: could I ask you a question that gets you back to the other, to the other issue? I- Is it i- is the government correct that you lose if the, if even if the rate applied by the FCC is wrong, that the only thing you're asking us is to say that the FCC has no jurisdiction? It wouldn't even matter if the FCC should have been treating this under E as telecommunications.

biggest companies in the United States.
